programme.desc: A whirlwind catch-up from matchday four of the Premier League, featuring Arsenal v Nottingham Forest, West Ham v Spurs and Man City v Man United.

programme.title: Serie A Full Impact
programme.desc: All the best moments from matchday three in Serie A, featuring Juventus v Inter, Fiorentina v Napoli, Roma v Torino, and Milan v Bologna.

programme.title: Live: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Cypriot champions Pafos make their UEFA Champions League debut as they travel to face Jose Luis Mendilibar's Olympiacos at Karaiskakis Stadium.

programme.title: Live: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Paris Saint-Germain kick-off the defence of their UEFA Champions League crown as they host Ivan Juric's Atalanta at Parc des Princes.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships
programme.desc: Highlights from day five of the 2025 Athletics World Championship in Tokyo, featuring the finals of the Men's Long Jump, Men's 1,500m and Women's 3,000m Steeplechase.

programme.title: UCI Continental Circuits
programme.desc: Men's Cycling Pro Series action as the 2025 Tour of Slovakia gets underway with a 140km route around the town of Bardejov.

programme.title: Tour de Luxembourg
programme.desc: Men's Cycling Pro Series action as the 2025 Tour of Luxembourg begins with a 152km route around Luxembourg City, starting at Knuedler and ending at Feschmaart.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Game one of the WNBA Playoffs between Phoenix Mercury and New York Liberty at PHX Arena.

programme.title: The Gruppetto
programme.desc: Hosted by Rob Hatch, The Gruppetto brings you everything you need to stay up to speed with the world of cycling, from in-depth race reviews to the latest news from the peloton.

programme.title: UCI WorldTour Cycling
programme.desc: Men's Cycling World Tour action from the 2025 Grand Prix Montreal. This 209km race takes the riders on 17 demanding laps around Mount Royal.

programme.title: UCI WorldTour Cycling
programme.desc: Men's Cycling World Tour action from the 2025 Grand Prix Quebec in Canada. This race features 18 laps of the city circuit, covering 216km and a total elevation gain of 2,610m.

programme.title: Cyclo-Cross
programme.desc: Coverage of the Hope Supercross in Bradford, the highest ranking cyclocross event of the 2025/26 UK season.

programme.title: The Gruppetto
programme.desc: Hosted by Rob Hatch, The Gruppetto brings you everything you need to stay up to speed with the world of cycling, from in-depth race reviews to the latest news from the peloton.

programme.title: Formula E Unplugged
programme.desc: NEOM McLaren's Jake Hughes and Nissan's Sacha Fenestraz are young men trying to prove their worth. We explore their journey on track and in life.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as bottom side Exeter Chiefs face Gloucester Rugby at Kingsholm Stadium. Can the struggling Chiefs find their first league win of the season?

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Newcastle Falcons take on Harlequins at Kingston Park Stadium. The Falcons have conceded 101 points in their last two games.

programme.title: Fishing: On the Bank
programme.desc: Anglers from all over the UK and Ireland gather at Lake of Menteith to compete for the largest cash prize in competition fly fishing in the Greys Lochstyle Team Championship.

programme.title: Global Champions Tour
programme.desc: The 2025 Longines Global Champions Tour heads to Germany, as the world's best show jumpers compete in the 2025 Grand Prix of Riesenbeck.

programme.title: NWSL
programme.desc: Action from the National Women's Soccer League as North Carolina Courage face Angel City FC.

programme.title: NWSL
programme.desc: Action from the National Women's Soccer League as Seb Hines' Orlando Pride face Bay FC at Inter&Co Stadium. Who will win this crucial clash between two out-of-form sides?

programme.title: Serie A Football
programme.desc: Igor Tudor's Juventus aim to make it three wins from three as rivals Inter visit the Allianz Stadium desperate to recover from their setback against Udinese.

programme.title: Serie A Football
programme.desc: Massimiliano Allegri's AC Milan seek their first Serie A home win of the season as they welcome Vincenzo Italiano's Bologna to San Siro.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Eredivisie winners PSV welcome Sebastien Pocognoli's Belgian champions Union Saint-Gilloise to Philips Stadion.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Real Madrid begin their pursuit of a 16th Champions League trophy as they host Roberto De Zerbi's Marseille at Santiago Bernabeu Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Two-time Champions League winners Juventus look to get their European campaign off to a strong start as they face Niko Kovac's Borussia Dortmund at Allianz Stadium.

programme.desc: Bruno Lage's Benfica face-off against Azerbaijani champions Qarabag at Estadio da Luz.

programme.desc: Claude Makelele looks back on a glittering 20-year career, during which he redefined the role of the defensive midfielder and gained legendary status at Stamford Bridge.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as Gloucester Rugby face-off against Sale Sharks at Kingsholm Stadium. Can the Sharks record their fourth league win in a row?

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as Leicester Tigers face Exeter Chiefs at Mattioli Woods Welford Road Stadium. Can the Chiefs build on their first league win of the season?

programme.title: PREM Rugby

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as Northampton Saints face league leaders Bath Rugby at Franklin's Gardens. Bath racked up 108 points in their final two league games of 2024.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Harlequins face Northampton Saints at Twickenham Stoop. The Saints were 33-29 winners when these teams met in October.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Gloucester Rugby take on Leicester Tigers at Kingsholm Stadium. Gloucester sit just three points behind Tigers in the table.

programme.title: PREM Rugby

programme.title: Live: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter, who offer the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.Guests: Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Ryan Clark, Mina Kimes, Field Yates, Adam Schefter, Keyshawn Johnson..

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: ESPN's daily college football show sharing reactions to the day's biggest stories and previews of each week's most important matchups. Kelsey Riggs and Jen Lada host alongside contributors Desmond Howard, Sam Acho, Greg McElroy and Pete Thamel.
